name: Because The World Never Stops
pitch: When we tune into a newscast, we expect a reassuring authority, but is what we see anything other than a performance? Shot behind the scenes during a live broadcast, Because the World Never Stops is a revelatory look at the hidden side of the evening news.

name: Heal the Living
pitch: Ivory Coast-born filmmaker Katell Quillévére adapts Maylis de Kerangal’s Booker Prize–longlisted novel for this elegant and affecting film which draws three seemingly unrelated stories together into a tale about the moment when tragedy meets hope.
production: Les Films du Bélier, Les Films Pelléas
producers: David Thion, Justin Taurand, Philippe Martin
sound: Florent Klockenbring, Benjamin Rosier, Emmanuel Croset
cast: Tahar Rahim, Emmanuelle Seigner, Anne Dorval, Bouli Lanners, Kool Shen, Monia Chokri, Alice Taglioni, Karim Leklou, Alice de Lencquesaing, Finnegan Oldfield, Théo Cholbi, Gabin Verdet, Dominique Blanc

name: Prevenge
pitch: Alice Lowe (Sightseers) is a triple threat as the writer, director and star of this pitch-black comedy about a pregnant woman whose unborn child psychically spurs her on to murder.
production: Western Edge Pictures, The Gennaker Group
producers: Vaughan Sivell, Will Kane, Jennifer Handorf
cast: Alice Lowe, Gemma Whelan, Kate Dickie, Jo Hartley, Dan Renton Skinner, Kayvan Novak, Mike Wozniak, Tom Davis, Tom Meeten

name: LUMIERE!
director: Louis Lumière, Auguste Lumière, Thierry Frémaux
pitch: Lumière! reintroduces some of cinema's foundational moments through gorgeous restored prints of the work of the Lumière Brothers.

name: American Pastoral
pitch: Ewan McGregor makes his directing debut and stars alongside Oscar winner Jennifer Connelly and Dakota Fanning in this ambitious adaptation of Philip Roth’s Pulitzer Prize–winning novel, about a "perfect" American family that is torn apart by the social and political upheavals of the 1960s.
producers: Tom Rosenberg, Gary Lucchesi, Andre Lamal
cast: Ewan McGregor, Jennifer Connelly, Dakota Fanning, Uzo Aduba, David Strathairn, Valorie Curry, Peter Riegert, Rupert Evans

name: Small Fry
pitch: A car ride gets bumpier for an American teenager trying to bond with her dad while visiting him in Poland. This tightly controlled, consistently surprising two-hander by Toronto’s Eva Michon makes the most of a breakout turn by Lucia Santina Ribisi and a hard-rocking musical interlude.
cast: Lucia Santina Ribisi, Robert Gonera

name: Water and Sugar: Carlo Di Palma, the Colours of Life
pitch: A galaxy of cinema luminaries — from Ken Loach and Ettore Scola to Wim Wenders and Bernardo Bertolucci — pay tribute to the great Italian cinematographer Carlo di Palma, in this loving documentary that chronicles di Palma’s extraordinary work for such directors as Elio Petri, Michelangelo Antonioni, and Woody Allen.

name: The Edge of Seventeen
pitch: Oscar nominees Hailee Steinfeld and Woody Harrelson star in this hilarious, edgy and poignant coming-of-age tale about an endearingly witty but self-absorbed teen whose life goes into a tailspin after her older brother starts dating her best friend.
production: STX Entertainment, Huayi Brothers Pictures, Gracie Films
producers: James L. Brooks, Richard Sakai, Julie Ansell
cast: Hailee Steinfeld, Woody Harrelson, Kyra Sedgwick, Haley Lu Richardson, Blake Jenner, Hayden Szeto

name: Trespass
pitch: A woman walking her dog alone in the forest finds company she didn’t expect and an enigma she can’t comprehend. Trespass is a thriller about the nature of sympathy... and the merits of keeping your pet on a leash.
cast: Maya Stange, Sara West

name: Blind Sun
pitch: During a scorching Greek summer, a stranded foreigner finds himself in a bureaucratic purgatory as he tries to retrieve his residence permit, while the crushing heat threatens to send him over the edge into paranoia and madness.
production: Blonde Audiovisual Productions, Good Lap Production, To Be Continued, Movie Partners in Motion Film
producers: Fenia Cossovitsa, Alain Peyrollaz, Vincent Brançon, Philippe Akoka, Dominique Marzotto, Lionel Guedj
score: Pierre Yves Casanova, Cédric "Pilooski" Marszewski, Frédéric le Louêt
cast: Ziad Bakri, Louis Do de Lencquesaing, Yannis Stankoglou, Laurène Brun, Gwendoline Hamon, Mimi Denissi

name: Decorado
pitch: From the brilliant mind of award-winning director Alberto Vázquez comes the animated vision of a world gone mad. Is this bizarre dystopian landscape real? Or are we all just living through set pieces in some strange movie?

name: Weirdos
pitch: Canadian master Bruce McDonald (Hard Core Logo, The Tracey Fragments) teams with veteran playwright and screenwriter Daniel MacIvor for this offbeat coming-of-age comedy-drama, about two Nova Scotian teens who hit the road in July 1976 accompanied by the laconic ghost of (the still-living) Andy Warhol.
production: Lithium Studios Productions, Shadow Shows, Holdfast Pictures
cast: Dylan Authors, Julia Sarah Stone, Molly Parker, Allan Hawco

name: City of Tiny Lights
pitch: In the teeming, multicultural metropolis of modern-day London, a seemingly straightforward missing-person case launches a down-at-heel private eye (Riz Ahmed, Nightcrawler) into a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue.
cast: Riz Ahmed, Cush Jumbo, James Floyd, Billie Piper, Roshan Seth

name: Into the Inferno
pitch: The great Werner Herzog teams up with volcanologist Clive Oppenheimer for this globe-trotting tour of some of the world’s most dangerous volcanoes.
production: Werner Herzog Film GMBH, Spring Films, Netflix, Inc.
cast: Clive Oppenheimer

name: Nutag - Homeland
pitch: During World War II, the Kalmyk people of the Soviet Union were forcibly relocated to Siberia, and nearly half of them died before the return home some 14 years later. This magnificently hand-painted visual poem is a heart-wrenching lament expressing loss and longing.
production: Alisi Telengut, Filmmaker Assistance Program of National Film Board of Canada

name: Four Faces of the Moon
pitch: This intricate stop-motion animation interlaces Canada’s colonial past with writer-director Amanda Strong’s personal family history — and illuminates Cree, Métis, and Anishinaabe reclamation of culture, language, and Nationhood.

name: BLACK HEAD COW
pitch: A bright student in a Maasai village learns that her arranged marriage to a much older man is imminent. Written by students in rural Tanzania, Black Head Cow intelligently outlines the pressures of traditional expectations.
producers: Lenga Kirika, Kesuma Mkare, Peter Luis
screenplay: Kesuma Mkare, Edward Elias, Flora Kipapurwa, Sioni Ayubu, Hosea Isaya
sound: Kesuma Mkare, Edward Elias, Hosea Isaya, David Forshee
cast: Naserian Mzee, Neema Kirika Laizer, Sophina Elias

name: The Last Leatherman of the Vale of Cashmere
pitch: A secluded pocket of wilderness in Brooklyn’s Prospect Park, the Vale of Cashmere has long served its community as a place for men looking to meet other men. But changing times mean a new purpose for the Vale, much to the chagrin of a proudly leather-clad old-timer who remembers the good old days and nights.
cast: Bern Cohen

name: The Secret Scripture
pitch: The hidden memoir of an elderly woman confined to a mental hospital reveals the history of her passionate yet tortured life, and of the religious and political upheavals in Ireland during the 1920s and ’30s. Rooney Mara, Jack Reynor, Eric Bana and Vanessa Redgrave star in this adaptation of Sebastian Barry’s award-winning 2008 novel from Oscar-nominated director Jim Sheridan (My Left Foot, In the Name of the Father).
producers: Noel Pearson, Jim Sheridan, Rob Quigley
cast: Rooney Mara, Vanessa Redgrave, Jack Reynor, Theo James, Eric Bana

name: Nelly
pitch: Award-winning filmmaker Anne Émond (Nuit #1, Les êtres chers) returns to the Festival with this creatively imagined biopic of controversial Quebec writer Nelly Arcan, who scandalized the French literary world with her semi-autobiographical novel based on her experiences as a sex worker.
cast: Mylène Mackay, Mylia Corbeil-Gavreau, Mickaël Gouin, Francis Leplay

name: Unless
pitch: Academy Award nominee Catherine Keener and Hannah Gross (I Used to Be Darker) star in this adaptation of the final novel by the late, great Canadian novelist Carol Shields, about a writer who discovers her runaway daughter panhandling on the street and seemingly deprived of speech.
producers: Jennifer Kawaja, Julia Sereny, Tristan Orpen Lynch, Aoife O'Sullivan
sound: Fionan Higgins, Stephen Marian, Robert Fletcher
cast: Catherine Keener, Matt Craven, Hannah Gross, Chloe Rose, Abigail Winter, Martha Henry, Brendan Coyle, Hanna Schygulla, Linda Kash, Benjamin Ayres

name: The Cinema Travellers
pitch: This lyrical documentary chronicles the vanishing tradition of the mobile "tent cinemas" that bring films to far-flung towns and villages across India.

name: Strange Weather
pitch: Academy Award winner Holly Hunter stars in this poignant drama about a grieving mother who travels the backroads of the Deep South to settle a score.
cast: Holly Hunter, Carrie Coon, Kim Coates

name: The Birth of a Nation
pitch: Writer-director Nate Parker reclaims the title of D.W. Griffith’s KKK-boosting 1916 milestone for this epic chronicle of the life of Nat Turner, who led a slave rebellion against white plantation owners in 1831 Virginia.
production: Bron Studios Inc, Phantom 4 Films, Mandalay Pictures, Tiny Giant Productions
producers: Nate Parker, Kevin Turen, Jason Michael Berman, Aaron L. Gilbert, Preston L. Holmes
cast: Nate Parker, Armie Hammer, Mark Boone Jr., Colman Domingo, Aunjanue Ellis, Dwight Henry, Aja Naomi King, Esther Scott, Roger Guenveur Smith, Gabrielle Union, Penelope Ann Miller, Jackie Earle Haley

name: Anatomy of Violence
pitch: Celebrated filmmaker Deepa Mehta investigates one of India’s most notorious crimes — the 2012 gang rape and murder of a 23-year-old woman on a Delhi bus — in her angry, impassioned and essential new film.
cast: Janki Bisht, Vansh Bhardwaj, Davinder Singh, Jagjeet Sandhu, Mukti Das, Suman Jha, Mahesh Saini, Tia Bhatia, Seema Biswas, Ramanjit Kaur, Debina Rakshit, Zorawar Shukla

name: Raw
pitch: A shy, vegetarian student at a veterinary college develops an insatiable lust for flesh as the result of a gruesome hazing ritual, in this grisly and gory tale of a cannibalistic coming of age.
production: Petit Film, Rouge International, Frakas Productions
producers: Jean des Forêts, Julie Gayet, Nadia Turincev, Jean-Yves Roubin, Cassandre Warnauts
sound: Mathieu Descamps, Severin Favriau, Stephane Thiebaut
cast: Garance Marillier, Ella Rumpf, Rabah Nait Oufella

name: Oh What a Wonderful Feeling
pitch: In this eye-popping film by Montreal’s François Jaros, a truck stop becomes a sinister realm of mystery. Though there’s no shortage of menacing presences to be found lurking between the hulking 16-wheelers, one young woman may yet find the means to stay safe and escape this strange netherworld.
cast: Karelle Tremblay, Frédérike Bédard, Catherine Hughes, Tania Kontoyanni, Ellen David, Patrice Beauchesne, Louis Negin

name: Message from the King
pitch: Chadwick Boseman, Teresa Palmer and Luke Evans star in this atmospheric revenge thriller from director Fabrice du Welz (Vinyan, Alléluia), about a mysterious traveller from South Africa combing the Los Angeles underworld for those responsible for the death of his sister.
production: Entertainment One, The Ink Factory, The Jokers Films, Entre Chien et Loup
producers: Stephen Cornwell, David Lancaster, Simon Cornwell
cast: Chadwick Boseman, Teresa Palmer, Luke Evans, Alfred Molina

name: The Road to Webequie
pitch: A mining company has promised to create opportunities for the remote Webequie First Nation. Through the eyes of three youths facing an uncertain future, this observational yet expansive documentary shows the struggles — and hopes — of a community confronting challenges that many Canadians will never experience.
producers: Ryan Noth, Tess Girard, Kersh Theva
screenplay: Ryan Noth, Tess Girard, Kersh Theva
score: Paul Aucoin, Andrew Whiteman, Ed Reifl

name: Snowden
pitch: Joseph Gordon-Levitt stars as NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden in this real-life political thriller from Oscar winner Oliver Stone, co-starring Shailene Woodley, Melissa Leo, Zachary Quinto, Timothy Olyphant and Nicolas Cage.
production: Sacha, Inc., Wild Bunch, TG Media, Krautpack Entertainment
producers: Moritz Borman, Fernando Sulichin, Philip Schulz-Deyle, Eric Kopeloff
cast: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Shailene Woodley, Melissa Leo, Zachary Quinto, Tom Wilkinson, Scott Eastwood, Logan Marshall-Green, Timothy Olyphant, Ben Schnetzer, Lakeith Lee Stanfield, Rhys Ifans, Nicolas Cage

name: The Skyjacker's Tale
pitch: Canadian documentarian Jamie Kastner (The Secret Disco Revolution) looks back at a notorious 1970s murder trial in the Virgin Islands — where five politicized young islanders were convicted of a massacre at a ritzy country club — and its dramatic aftermath a decade later, when the culprits’ ostensible leader staged a skyjacking and found refuge in Cuba.
score: Adam White, David Wall, Jamie Shields
cast: Ishmael Muslim Ali, Margaret Ratner Kunstler, Michael Ratner

name: King of the Dancehall
pitch: Nick Cannon directs and stars in this high-energy musical about a young man from Brooklyn who gets caught up in the vibrant Kingston music scene during a visit to Jamaica.
cast: Nick Cannon, Whoopi Goldberg, Busta Rhymes, Peter Stormare, Kimberly Patterson, Lou Gossett Jr., Kreesha Turner, Ky Mani Marley, Collie Budz, Killer Bean, Beenie Man

name: Maudie
pitch: Academy Award nominees Sally Hawkins (Happy-Go-Lucky, Blue Jasmine) and Ethan Hawke star in the true story of Maud Lewis, who overcame the physical challenge of juvenile rheumatoid arthritis to become one of Canada’s premier folk artists.
production: Small Shack Productions Inc., Painted House Films, Parallel Films
producers: Bob Cooper, Mary Young Leckie, Mary  Sexton, Susan Mullen
cast: Sally Hawkins, Ethan Hawke

name: The Pine Tree Villa
pitch: Lion and Bird walk through Berlin, past a long-uninhabited villa where, surprisingly, lights burn in the windows. Curiosity drives Lion inside, and though caution compels Bird to stay behind, he must fight to save his friend from danger when an extraordinary world emerges from the shadows.
cast: Johanna Gagern, Christoph Letkowski, Paolo Massini, Anna Luisa Schmidt

name: The Belko Experiment
pitch: Office politics turns into a real-life survival of the fittest when a group of co-workers are forced into a sick game of kill or be killed by sinister forces who lock down their building, in this gruesomely funny horror thriller from director Greg McLean (Wolf Creek) and writer James Gunn (Slither, Guardians of the Galaxy).
production: Orion Pictures, Troll Court Entertainment, The Safran Company
cast: John Gallagher Jr, Tony Goldwyn, Adria Arjona, John C. McGinley, Melonie Diaz, Owain Yeoman, Sean Gunn, Brent Sexton, Josh Brener, David Dastmalchian, David Del Rio, Gregg Henry, Rusty Schwimmer, Gail Bean, James Earl, Abraham Benrubi

name: India In a Day
pitch: Directed by Richie Mehta, executive produced by Ridley Scott and powered by Google, India in a Day is a new form of non-fiction filmmaking that uses footage shot by millions of people in India on one single day to assemble a lyrical portrait of modern India.

name: Werewolf
pitch: The hardscrabble existence of two homeless, twentysomething drug addicts is portrayed with sensitivity and brutal honesty in the debut feature by Ashley McKenzie.
cast: Andrew Gillis, Bhreagh MacNeil

name: The Age of Shadows
pitch: Korean superstars Song Kang-ho, Han Ji-min, and Gong Yoo headline the latest from cutting-edge director Kim Jee-woon (The Good, the Bad, the Weird), an epic-scale period thriller about a double agent sent to infiltrate a band of freedom fighters during the Japanese occupation of Korea in the 1920s.
production: Grimm Pictures, Warner Bros. Korea Local Production, Harbin Films
producers: Kim Jee woon, Choi Jae weon, Kim Jee woon, Lee Jin sook, Choi Jeong hwa
screenplay: Lee Ji min, Park Jong dae
cast: Song Kang ho, Gong Yoo, Han Ji min

name: The Horse Thief
pitch: One of the greatest achievements of Fifth Generation Chinese cinema, Tian Zhuangzhuang's ravishingly beautiful epic set in the vastness of rural Tibet was famously praised by Martin Scorsese as the best film he saw in the 1990s.
cast: Tseshang Rigzin, Dan Jiji, Jayang Jamco

name: Karl Marx City
pitch: Petra Epperlein and Michael Tucker (Gunner Palace, The Prisoner or: How I Planned to Kill Tony Blair) take a powerfully personal journey through the former East Germany, as Epperlein investigates her father’s 1999 suicide and the possibility that he may have worked as a spy for the dreaded Stasi security service.

name: Inner Workings
pitch: Inner Workings goes inside a man's psyche to show us the battle between his practical side and his carefree impulses. With great heart, a fun beat, and verve galore, this is a charming animation — boasting a unique blend of cutting-edge and classic techniques — from the story artist for Big Hero 6 and Wreck-It Ralph.

name: The Limehouse Golem
pitch: In Victorian-era London, an intrepid police inspector (Bill Nighy) investigates a series of brutal killings that seem to be linked to a fearsome creature of Jewish legend, in this atmospheric thriller based on the bestseller by Peter Ackroyd.
producers: Stephen Woolley, Joanna Laurie, Elizabeth Karlsen
cast: Bill Nighy, Olivia Cooke, Douglas Booth, Daniel Mays, Sam Reid, Maria Valverde, Eddie Marsan

name: Mostly Sunny
pitch: Veteran filmmaker Dilip Mehta (Cooking with Stella) returns to the Festival with this fascinating documentary portrait of porn actress turned Bollywood starlet Sunny Leone.
screenplay: Craig Thompson, Dilip  Mehta, Deepa Mehta
cast: Sunny Leone

name: TMG_103 (rough cut)
pitch: In this insightful behind-the-scenes examination of sexual politics on set, a director pressures an actress into full nudity on the morning of her first sex scene.
production: VIEW Entertainment Group, Walt Sidney Productions
cast: Sidney Leeder, Shaun Benson, Shannon Kook, Dean Armstrong

name: The Girl with All the Gifts
pitch: A sweet little girl who may hold the key to a cure for the zombie virus that has decimated most of the world’s population escapes from a military compound and sets out to find her place in the world.
cast: Gemma Arterton, Paddy Considine, Glenn Close, Sennia Nanua

name: The Oath
pitch: Icelandic auteur Baltasar Kormákur (Contraband, 2 Guns, Everest) directs and stars in this psychological thriller about a father who tries to pull his daughter out of her world of drugs and petty crime, only to find that danger can be found in unexpected places.
cast: Baltasar Kormákur, Hera Hilmar, Gísli Örn Garðarsson

name: Politics, Instructions Manual
pitch: A fascinating behind-the-scenes documentary about the rise of Podemos, the insurgent Spanish political party founded on the basis of a nationwide anti-austerity movement that dramatically upended the country’s traditional, hidebound two-party system.
production: MEDIAPRODUCCION S.L.U., Reposado Producciones Cinematográficas S.L.
producers: Jaume Roures, Fernando León de Aranoa
sound: Daniel de Zayas, Daniel Peña, Alfonso Raposo

name: Carrie Pilby
pitch: Awkward, isolated and disapproving of most of the people around her, a precocious 19-year-old genius is challenged to put her convictions to the test by venturing out on to the NYC dating scene, in this adaptation of Caren Lissner’s best-selling 2003 novel.
producers: Susan Johnson, Suzanne Farwell, Susan Cartsonis, Brent Emery, Lisa Wolofsky
cast: Bel Powley, Nathan Lane, Gabriel Byrne, Vanessa Bayer, Colin O'Donoghue, Jason Ritter, William Moseley

name: Dadyaa
pitch: In their remote village, haunted by memories, Atimaley and Devi find themselves faced with a dilemma when a dear friend leaves without saying goodbye.
production: Les Films du Tambour, Eyecore Films PVT LTD
producers: Prajjwal SJB Rana, Rani Massalha, Marie Legrand
cast: Parimal Damai, Chham Kala Damai

name: The Handmaiden
pitch: A crook-turned-servant falls for the vulnerable heiress she had originally schemed to swindle, in this audacious, visually sumptuous, and highly erotic period piece from acclaimed writer-director Park Chan-wook.
cast: Kim Min-hee, Kim Tae-ri, Ha Jung-woo, Cho Jin-woong, Kim Hae-sook, Moon So-ri

name: One-Eyed Jacks
pitch: Beautifully restored thanks to the efforts of Martin Scorsese and Steven Spielberg, Marlon Brando’s only film as director is a brilliant and idiosyncratic revenge western about a betrayed bandit (Brando) hunting down the partner (Karl Malden) who left him in the lurch.
cast: Marlon Brando, Karl Malden, Pina Pellicer, Katy Jurado, Ben Johnson, Slim Pickens, Larry Duran, Sam Gilman, Timothy Carey, Miriam Colon

name: Blind Vaysha
pitch: With one eye that can only see the past and one that can only see the future, a man is tormented by two irreconcilable realities. Blind Vaysha is a vivid and gorgeously crafted 3D fable about living in the present.
cast: Caroline Dhavernas

name: Beauties of the Night
pitch: A captivating group portrait of iconic showgirls who enthralled thousands during the disco-era heyday of Mexico’s burlesque culture.
producers: María José Cuevas, Christian Valdelièvre, Moisés Cosío, Gerardo Gatica
cast: Olga Breeskin, Lyn May, Rossy Mendoza, Wanda Seux, Princesa Yamal

name: Plain and Simple
pitch: Though isolated from each other and the world at large, the four characters in this spare and affecting drama share one thing: a fierce desire to alleviate their feelings of loneliness. Plain and Simple is another startling demonstration of the talents of Raphaël Ouellet, one of Canada’s most skilled young filmmakers.
cast: Alderic Kenné, Marguerite D'Amour, Julie Roussel, Mario Cadieux

name: The Journey
pitch: Timothy Spall (Mr. Turner) and Colm Meaney (The Commitments) star in this dramatization of the events preceding the historic 2006 St. Andrews Agreement, which brought peace to Northern Ireland after years of violent strife between Unionist and Republican factions.
producers: Piers Tempest, Mark Huffam, Nick Hamm, Matt Jackson, Stuart Ford
cast: Timothy Spall, Colm Meaney, John Hurt, Toby Stephens, Freddie Highmore

name: 5 Films About Technology
pitch: The characters in Peter Huang’s razor-sharp satire are as dependent as the rest of us on the devices that are supposed to make us smarter, better, and faster. But, as this hilarious series of scenarios reveals, all that tech may be making us the exact opposite of what we’ve been promised.
cast: Michelle Mylett, Kate Drummond, Spencer MacPherson, Aislinn Paul, Chloe Rose, Jonathan Keltz, Supinder Wraich, Marilla Wex, Brendan Halloran, Paul Beer

name: Forever Pure
pitch: Filmmaker Maya Zinshtein embeds herself inside the locker room of Jerusalem’s Beitar football club, which became a flashpoint for controversy in 2012 when the signing of two Muslim players brought down the racist wrath of the team’s long-time fans.
production: Duckin' & Divin' Films, Maya Films, Passion Pictures, Roads Entertainment, Piraya Film AS
producers: Geoff Arbourne, Maya Zinshtein, Alan Maher, Torstein Grude
cinematographers: Sergei (Israel) Freedman, Yaniv Linton, Ross McDonnell

name: Queen of Katwe
pitch: David Oyelowo (Selma) and Academy Award winner Lupita Nyong’o (12 Years a Slave) star in the true story of a young girl from rural Uganda (played by newcomer Madina Nalwanga) who discovers a passion for chess, and sets out to pursue her dream of becoming an international champion.
cast: David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o, Madina Nalwanga

name: The Battle of Algiers
pitch: Gillo Pontecorvo's gritty, stirring, and unabashedly anti-colonialist account of the urban war between battle-hardened French paratroopers and Algerian resistance fighters became an instant flashpoint for controversy and was banned in France until 1971.
cast: Saadi Yacef, Brahim Haggiag, Jean Martin

name: Whispering Breeze
pitch: In this captivating ode to the beauty of childhood and the pain of exile, director Jonathan Tremblay combines black-and-white images of a coastal town with the imagined words of an elderly woman who longs to see her home once more.
cast: Mara Joly, Benoît Côté, Nicole DesRoches

name: Half A Man
pitch: Two sisters in 1991 Croatia prepare a special homecoming for their father on the day he’s set to return after three months as a prisoner of war. Kristina Kumric crafts a powerful portrait of a family that’s just beginning to see the damage it’s suffered.
producers: Vanja Jambrovic, Tibor Keser, Hélène Mitjavile, Hrvoje Osvadic
cast: Janja Avdagic, Leonarda Zivkovic

name: The Commune
pitch: The new film from Danish auteur Thomas Vinterberg (The Hunt, The Celebration) focuses on a middle-aged professional couple in 1970s Denmark who decide to experiment with communal living by inviting a group of friends and random eccentrics to cohabit with them in a sprawling house.
production: Zentropa, Zentropa International Sweden, Topkapi Films
sound: Anne Jensen, Kristian Selin Eidnes Andersen
cast: Trine Dyrholm, Ulrich Thomsen, Helene Reingaard Neumann

name: Gods Acre
pitch: Frank lives alone on his family’s ancestral Cree lands, but water levels are rising due to climate change, and evacuation seems more necessary every day. Lorne Cardinal is brilliant as a taciturn man wrestling with a decision: whether to abandon his home or adapt to his changing environment.
production: Half Breed Films, Wood Buffalo Productions, Broken Tree Productions
producers: Kelton Stepanowich, Mike Mankowski, Eric Janvier
cast: Lorne Cardinal, Greg Lawson, Rollie Pemberton, Christopher Taber

name: Neruda
pitch: Pablo Larraín (The Club, No, Tony Manero) weaves an engrossing metafictional fable around the 1948 manhunt for celebrated poet and politician Pablo Neruda, who goes underground when Chile outlaws communism and is pursued by an ambitious police inspector (Gael García Bernal) hoping to make a name for himself by capturing the famous fugitive.
production: Fabula, Funny Balloons, AZ Films, Setembro Cine
cast: Gael García Bernal, Luis Gnecco, Mercedes Morán, Diego Muñoz, Pablo Derqui, Alfredo Castro, Michael Silva

name: All Governments Lie: Truth, Deception, and the Spirit of I.F. Stone
pitch: Vancouver-based filmmaker and TV news veteran Fred Peabody explores the life and legacy of the maverick American journalist I.F. Stone, whose long one-man crusade against government deception lives on in the work of such contemporary filmmakers and journalists as Laura Poitras, Glenn Greenwald, David Corn, and Matt Taibbi.
producers: Peter Raymont, Fred Peabody, Andrew Munger, Steve Ord
sound: Jason Milligan, Sanjay Mehta, Peter Sawade

name: Paraya
pitch: A troubled young mother drifts through the bustling city of Durban in search of the disappeared father of her child. Paraya is a stark portrayal of a woman’s attempt to shape her future.
cast: Mishqah Parthiephal, Hemish Kyd, Joy Mbwena, Mpumelelo Bhulose

name: Mutants
pitch: A teenager just trying to make it through the summer of 1996, Keven begins his baseball season with an accident that leaves him with a truly hideous black eye. This leads to a crash course in sex, sports, and scandal — taught by a hilariously unconventional coach — that does a demolition job on coming-of-age story conventions.
cast: Joseph DeLorey, Tanya Quirion, Jérémy Labonté, Francis La Haye, Sandrine Bisson

name: Blue Jay
pitch: Meeting by chance when they return to their tiny California hometown, two former high-school sweethearts (Mark Duplass and Sarah Paulson) reflect on their shared past through the lens of their differently dissatisfied presents, in this tender, wise and affecting chamber drama from first-time feature director Alex Lehmann.
cast: Mark Duplass, Sarah  Paulson

name: A New Home
pitch: This home is so new that no one is even in the building yet. So when a young woman convinces the leasing agent to let her move in early, she isn’t expecting to cross paths with anyone. Is she in danger, or is it her own paranoia that she should be afraid of?
cast: Nina Rakovec, Jernej Campelj, Katarina Mavsar, Jakob Mavsar, Blaz Masvar, Zan Luka Mavsar

name: Red of the Yew Tree
pitch: A pheasant hunt becomes a spellbinding elemental odyssey in animator Marie-Hélène Turcotte’s visionary rendering of femininity and intuition.

name: The Wasted Times
pitch: Superstars Zhang Ziyi, Ge You, and Tadanobu Asano headline this hotly anticipated, stylistic thriller set in the Shanghai underworld of the 1930s.
producers: Zhang Dajun, T.K Yang, Lina Wu
cast: Zhang Ziyi, Ge You, Tadanobu Asano

name: Deepwater Horizon
pitch: Mark Wahlberg, Kurt Russell, John Malkovich, Kate Hudson and Gina Rodriguez (Jane the Virgin) headline this true-life disaster tale about the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that led to the biggest oil spill in US history.
production: di Bonaventura Pictures, Closest to the Hole, Leverage Entertainment
producers: Lorenzo di Bonaventura, Mark Vahradian, Mark Wahlberg, Stephen Levinson, David Womark
cast: Mark Wahlberg, Kurt Russell, John Malkovich, Gina Rodriguez, Dylan O'Brien, Kate Hudson

name: Souvenir
pitch: Isabelle Huppert stars as a middle-aged factory worker whose long-ago brush with fame comes to the fore again when she begins a romance with a young aspiring boxer.
production: Bonjour Pictures, Avenue B Productions, Frakas Productions, Deal Production
screenplay: Bavo Defurne, Yves Verbraeken, Jacques Boon
cast: Isabelle Huppert, Kévin Azaïs, Johan Leysen

name: An Insignificant Man
pitch: Filmmakers Khushboo Ranka and Vinay Shukla follow Arvind Kejriwal, "the Bernie Sanders of India," as he shakes up the complacent and corrupt status quo of Indian politics as the head of the Common Man’s Party.
producers: Anand Gandhi, Khushboo Ranka, Vinay Shukla
cinematographers: Khushboo Ranka, Vinay Shukla, Vinay Rohira
cast: Arvind Kejriwal, Yogendra Yadav, Santosh Koli

name: Gimme Danger
